channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Officials defend pardon for Pemberton
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Administration officials were on the defensive yesterday amid criticism over President Duterte’s granting of absolute pardon to US Marine Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton, who was convicted by a local court for killing Filipino transgender Jeffrey “Jennifer” Laude in October 2014.

item.title: 748 private schools suspend operations
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Hundreds of private elementary and high schools across the country will suspend operations this school year due to low enrollment of students, according to the Department of Education.

item.title: Duterte to Bong: Don’t be a ‘yes man’
item.author: Edith Regalado
item.description: President Duterte has told his long-time close aide and now Sen. Bong Go to sometimes criticize him and not just be a “yes man” all the time.

item.title: Metrobank gives P30 million grants for 58th anniversary
item.description: Metrobank previously donated P220 million to fund and support the national government’s efforts to combat the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Closure of cemeteries nationwide eyed for ‘Undas’
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Cemeteries nationwide may be closed during the All Saints’ Day break to avoid crowding, an official of the body that implements the government’s coronavirus policy said.

item.title: CHR exec dismayed over Pemberton pardon
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: An official of the Commission on Human Rights has expressed disappointment over the decision of President Duterte to pardon homicide convict US Marine Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton.

item.title: Pemberton to write apology letter to Laude family
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: US Marine Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton, recently granted absolute pardon by President Duterte after being convicted for killing Filipino transgender Jennifer Laude six years ago, will push through with his letter of apology to the Laude family, according to Pemberton’s lawyer.

item.title: Meralco rates down this month
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: Manila Electric Co. announced that its rates would go down for the fifth straight month this September as generation charges continue to drop.

item.title: PhilHealth task force: Recommendations may fall short of expectations
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: Given only a month to investigate the anomalies in the Philippine Health Insurance Corp., Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra yesterday said their report and recommendations might fall short of public expectations.

item.title: 330K COVID-19 cases seen by month’s end
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: A research team from the University of the Philippines said the number of COVID-19 cases in the country may rise to 330,000 to 375,000 by the end of September, although the country is headed in the right direction in its response to the coronavirus pandemic.c
